ingredients.name: Unsalted Butter
ingredients.notes: divided 4 Tablespoon cubed, 4 Tablespoon melted and cooled

ingredients.name: Bourbon
ingredients.notes: divided 1, 2 chilled (optional, replaces 2 Tablespoons of ice water)

steps.text: Chill 4 Tbsp of the butter in the freezer for 15 minutes, then cube it.
Put 3.5 oz of the toasted pecans in the food processor and pulse 5-6 times.
Add the cubed butter to the pecans, and pulse 5-6 more times.
Add the flour and 1/2 tsp of the salt to the processor, then pulse 4-5 times.
Finally add the water (and bourbon), and pulse 5-6 times or until mixture holds together like dough.
Transfer to a zip-lock bag and squeeze into a ball.  Press into a round disc and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
While the dough is in the fridge,  preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl whisk together the eggs, sugar, corn syrup, melted butter, vanilla, (bourbon), and remaining salt, then set aside.
Take the dough disc out of the fridge and cut the sides of the bag.  Sprinkle both sides with flour and cover with bag.
Roll the dough to an 11” diameter.  Place the dough in 9.5”-10” tart pan 2” deep.  Press the dough into the pan.
Sprinkle the 6 oz of chopped pecans into the pan, then pour the filling on top.
Remove from oven and place remaining 2 oz of pecans on top of pie.
Return to oven for 10 minutes, or until center of pie reaches 200°F measured with an instant read thermometer and a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool the pie to room temperature before serving (about 3-4 hours).
